cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest, crossing the northeastern Yucatan early Wednesday, then moving north-northwest through the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coast late Friday

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. Gulf Coast watches in effect as of Advisory 7A
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. Gulf Coast warnings in effect; hurricane warnings confined to Yucatan Peninsula
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast to the Mississippi Delta likely to experience tropical-storm conditions; highest impacts centered on Louisiana coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (track favors Louisiana, surge for upper TX coast currently forecast below 3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (34–50 kt) possible Friday night into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises of 1–3 ft possible along Sabine/Neches estuary
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday–Saturday totalling 2–4 inches, locally higher
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands during Friday evening/Saturday
